Commentary.ab: Y10.14a] The verse presents several problems (vid. infra commentaries on gāuš drafšo and vārəma caire). Meaning obscure. Likely "May you not be quiet for me, like a drop of milk / like a bull-banner, in order to circulate at your will (in my body)". Cf. context Y10.14b and Y10.14c.

Y10.14a gāuš drafšō] Pirart gāuš.drafšō. On thee meaning of drafša- as "banner", vid. Bartholomae, cf. Pahl. transl. gāv-drafš and Skt. transl. gopatākīyā "bull-banner"; as "drop", vid. Kellens, Pirart, cf. OInd. drapsá-.

Y10.14a vārəma caire] sec. cod. 5, 100, 400, 410, 510, 4010, 4020, 4025, 4075, 4161, 4280 (varə̄ma cairi 83, 110, 235, 4045, 4050) and Bartholomae. caire as inf. and vārəma "at will", cf. Yt17.2, Yt5.130 and Pahl. transl. az wārom; Geldner, Kellens vārəm acaire: not attested, but vārəmacaire in Ind. mss. with acaire as inf. negative and vārəm as "filter"; Pirart vārəm acairi: not attested and acairias aor. pass. but expected *acāiri). vārəm cairi in 8, 15, VrS Ir. and 5020 (reanalyzed vārəm as acc. sg.?).
